speaker: Hunter
lines: A tarp leans on a wishbone of saplings; smoke goes straight up as if climbing home.
The hunter sharpens in circles; the knife is an excuse to think in arcs.
He does not stand, but his eyes arrive first and bring his face after.
'Trail's busy today,' he says. 'Wolves testing the weave. Witch-sign on the west side.'
He flips a charm in his hand—a tooth wrapped in thread—swallows a thought instead of a drink.
'If you go streamward, carry hush. If you go hillward, carry hurry.'
He sees the set of your shoulders and measures you like weather.
'Take one of these or return it to the tree later.'

give_item.name: Hunter's Charm
give_item.description: A tooth that doesn't mind being bitten
